oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Joel Barlow
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Joel Barlow (1754-1812) seated at desk with sheaf of papers in hand. Note below painting, "From the original painting by Chappel, in the possession of the publishers. Johnson, Fry & Co. Publishers, New York. Entered according to Act of Congress AD. 1863 by Johnson, Fry & Co. in the clerk's office of the district court of the southern district of N.Y."
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Authors; Engraving; Correspondence; Offices
Barlow, Joel, 1754-1812
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Poet, diplomat, chaplain for the Revolutionary Army, and author of "The Hasty Pudding" (1796). Ambassador to France during the Napoleonic era, he perished in Poland during Boney's retreat from Moscow.
